Add new variables and drop all others

Source: R/transmute.R
transmute..Rd

Unlike mutate.(), transmute.() keeps only the variables that you create

transmute.(.df, ..., .by = NULL, by = NULL)

dt_transmute(.df, ..., .by = NULL, by = NULL)

Arguments

.df

A data.frame or data.table
...

Columns to create/modify
.by

Columns to group by
by

This argument has been renamed to .by and is deprecated

Examples

mtcars %>%
  transmute.(displ_l = disp / 61.0237)
#>      displ_l
#>  1: 2.621932
#>  2: 2.621932
#>  3: 1.769804
#>  4: 4.227866
#>  5: 5.899347
#>  6: 3.687092
#>  7: 5.899347
#>  8: 2.403984
#>  9: 2.307300
#> 10: 2.746474
#> 11: 2.746474
#> 12: 4.519556
#> 13: 4.519556
#> 14: 4.519556
#> 15: 7.734700
#> 16: 7.538055
#> 17: 7.210313
#> 18: 1.289663
#> 19: 1.240502
#> 20: 1.165121
#> 21: 1.968088
#> 22: 5.211090
#> 23: 4.981671
#> 24: 5.735477
#> 25: 6.554830
#> 26: 1.294579
#> 27: 1.971365
#> 28: 1.558411
#> 29: 5.751864
#> 30: 2.376126
#> 31: 4.932510
#> 32: 1.982836
#>      displ_l
